member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GlossariesResource.ListRequest
member.summary: Lists glossaries in a project. Returns NOT_FOUND, if the project doesn't exist.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GlossariesResource.ListRequest.Parent
member.summary: Required. The name of the project from which to list all of the glossaries.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GlossariesResource.ListRequest.Filter
member.summary: Optional. Filter specifying constraints of a list operation. Specify the constraint by the format of "key=value", where key must be "src" or "tgt", and the value must be a valid language code. For multiple restrictions, concatenate them by "AND" (uppercase only), such as: "src=en-US AND tgt=zh-CN". Notice that the exact match is used here, which means using 'en-US' and 'en' can lead to different results, which depends on the language code you used when you create the glossary. For the unidirectional glossaries, the "src" and "tgt" add restrictions on the source and target language code separately. For the equivalent term set glossaries, the "src" and/or "tgt" add restrictions on the term set. For example: "src=en-US AND tgt=zh-CN" will only pick the unidirectional glossaries which exactly match the source language code as "en-US" and the target language code "zh-CN", but all equivalent term set glossaries which contain "en- US" and "zh-CN" in their language set will be picked. If missing, no filtering is performed.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GlossariesResource.ListRequest.PageSize
member.summary: Optional. Requested page size. The server may return fewer glossaries than requested. If unspecified, the server picks an appropriate default.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GlossariesResource.ListRequest.PageToken
member.summary: Optional. A token identifying a page of results the server should return. Typically, this is the value of [ListGlossariesResponse.next_page_token] returned from the previous call to `ListGlossaries` method. The first page is returned if `page_token`is empty or missing.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.OperationsResource.Cancel(Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.CancelOperationRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Starts asynchronous cancellation on a long-running operation. The server makes a best effort to cancel the operation, but success is not guaranteed. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Clients can use Operations.GetOperation or other methods to check whether the cancellation succeeded or whether the operation completed despite cancellation. On successful cancellation, the operation is not deleted; instead, it becomes an operation with an Operation.error value with a google.rpc.Status.code of 1, corresponding to `Code.CANCELLED`.
member.param: The body of the request.
The name of the operation resource to be cancelled.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.OperationsResource.List(System.String)
member.summary:
Lists operations that match the specified filter in the request. If the server doesn't support this method, it returns `UNIMPLEMENTED`.
NOTE: the `name` binding allows API services to override the binding to use different resource name schemes, such as `users/operations`. To override the binding, API services can add a binding such as `"/v1/{name=users}/operations"` to their service configuration. For backwards compatibility, the default name includes the operations collection id, however overriding users must ensure the name binding is the parent resource, without the operations collection id.
member.param: The name of the operation's parent resource.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.OperationsResource.ListRequest
member.summary:

NOTE: the `name` binding allows API services to override the binding to use different resource name schemes, such as `users/operations`. To override the binding, API services can add a binding such as `"/v1/{name=users}/operations"` to their service configuration. For backwards compatibility, the default name includes the operations collection id, however overriding users must ensure the name binding is the parent resource, without the operations collection id.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.OperationsResource.Wait(Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.WaitOperationRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Waits for the specified long-running operation until it is done or reaches at most a specified timeout, returning the latest state. If the operation is already done, the latest state is immediately returned. If the timeout specified is greater than the default HTTP/RPC timeout, the HTTP/RPC timeout is used. If the server does not support this method, it returns `google.rpc.Code.UNIMPLEMENTED`. Note that this method is on a best-effort basis. It may return the latest state before the specified timeout (including immediately), meaning even an immediate response is no guarantee that the operation is done.
member.param: The body of the request.
The name of the operation resource to wait on.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.BatchTranslateText(Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest,System.String)
member.summary:
Translates a large volume of text in asynchronous batch mode. This function provides real-time output as the inputs are being processed. If caller cancels a request, the partial results (for an input file, it's all or nothing) may still be available on the specified output location.
This call returns immediately and you can use google.longrunning.Operation.name to poll the status of the call.
member.param: The body of the request.

Required. Location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}`.
The `global` location is not supported for batch translation.
Only AutoML Translation models or glossaries within the same region (have the same location-id) can be used, otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.BatchTranslateTextRequest
member.summary:
Translates a large volume of text in asynchronous batch mode. This function provides real-time output as the inputs are being processed. If caller cancels a request, the partial results (for an input file, it's all or nothing) may still be available on the specified output location.
This call returns immediately and you can use google.longrunning.Operation.name to poll the status of the call.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.BatchTranslateTextRequest.Parent
member.summary:
Required. Location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}`.
The `global` location is not supported for batch translation.
Only AutoML Translation models or glossaries within the same region (have the same location-id) can be used, otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.summary: Returns the body of the request.

member.summary: Detects the language of text within a request.
member.param: The body of the request.

Required. Project or location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}` or `projects/{project-number-or-id}`.
For global calls, use `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/global` or `projects/{project-number-or-id}`.
Only models within the same region (has same location-id) can be used. Otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.param:
Required. Project or location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GetSupportedLanguagesRequest.DisplayLanguageCode
member.summary: Optional. The language to use to return localized, human readable names of supported languages. If missing, then display names are not returned in a response.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.GetSupportedLanguagesRequest.Model
member.summary:
Optional. Get supported languages of this model.
The format depends on model type:
- AutoML Translation models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/{model- id}`
- General (built-in) models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location- id}/models/general/nmt`, `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location- id}/models/general/base`
Returns languages supported by the specified model. If missing, we get supported languages of Google general base (PBMT) model.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.LocationsResource.TranslateText(Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest,System.String)
member.summary: Translates input text and returns translated text.
member.param: The body of the request.

Required. Project or location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}` or `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}`.
For global calls, use `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/global` or `projects/{project-number-or-id}`.
Non-global location is required for requests using AutoML models or custom glossaries.
Models and glossaries must be within the same region (have same location-id), otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.summary:
Required. Project or location to make a call. Must refer to a caller's project.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}` or `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}`.
For global calls, use `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/global` or `projects/{project-number- or-id}`.
Non-global location is required for requests using AutoML models or custom glossaries.
Models and glossaries must be within the same region (have same location-id), otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.TranslateTextRequest.Body
member.summary: Gets or sets the body of this request.

member.name: M:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.ProjectsResource.TranslateTextRequest.GetBody
member.summary: Returns the body of the request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest.Glossaries
member.summary: Optional. Glossaries to be applied for translation. It's keyed by target language code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest.Labels
member.summary:
Optional. The labels with user-defined metadata for the request.
Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters (Unicode codepoints), can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional. Label keys must start with a letter.
See https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/labels for more information.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest.Models
member.summary:
Optional. The models to use for translation. Map's key is target language code. Map's value is model name. Value can be a built-in general model, or an AutoML Translation model.
The value format depends on model type:
- AutoML Translation models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/{model-id}`
- General (built-in) models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/general/nmt`, `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/general/base`
If the map is empty or a specific model is not requested for a language pair, then default google model (nmt) is used.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest.OutputConfig
member.summary: Required. Output configuration. If 2 input configs match to the same file (that is, same input path), we don't generate output for duplicate inputs.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.BatchTranslateTextRequest.TargetLanguageCodes
member.summary: Required. Specify up to 10 language codes here.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageRequest
member.summary: The request message for language detection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageRequest.Content
member.summary: The content of the input stored as a string.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageRequest.Labels
member.summary:
Optional. The labels with user-defined metadata for the request.
Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters (Unicode codepoints), can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional. Label keys must start with a letter.
See https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/labels for more information.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageRequest.MimeType
member.summary: Optional. The format of the source text, for example, "text/html", "text/plain". If left blank, the MIME type defaults to "text/html".

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageRequest.Model
member.summary:
Optional. The language detection model to be used.
Format: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/language-detection/{model-id}`
Only one language detection model is currently supported: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations /{location-id}/models/language-detection/default`.
If not specified, the default model is used.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageResponse
member.summary: The response message for language detection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectLanguageResponse.Languages
member.summary: A list of detected languages sorted by detection confidence in descending order. The most probable language first.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectedLanguage
member.summary: The response message for language detection.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectedLanguage.Confidence
member.summary: The confidence of the detection result for this language.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.DetectedLanguage.LanguageCode
member.summary: The BCP-47 language code of source content in the request, detected automatically.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Empty
T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.GcsDestination
member.summary: The Google Cloud Storage location for the output content.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.GcsDestination.OutputUriPrefix
member.summary: Required. The bucket used in 'output_uri_prefix' must exist and there must be no files under 'output_uri_prefix'. 'output_uri_prefix' must end with "/" and start with "gs://". One 'output_uri_prefix' can only be used by one batch translation job at a time. Otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.GcsSource
member.summary: The Google Cloud Storage location for the input content.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.GcsSource.InputUri
member.summary: Required. Source data URI. For example, `gs://my_bucket/my_object`.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary
member.summary: Represents a glossary built from user provided data.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.EndTime
member.summary: Output only. When the glossary creation was finished.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.EntryCount
member.summary: Output only. The number of entries defined in the glossary.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.InputConfig
member.summary: Required. Provides examples to build the glossary from. Total glossary must not exceed 10M Unicode codepoints.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.LanguageCodesSet
member.summary: Used with equivalent term set glossaries.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.Name
member.summary: Required. The resource name of the glossary. Glossary names have the form `projects/{project- number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/glossaries/{glossary-id}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Glossary.SubmitTime
member.summary: Output only. When CreateGlossary was called.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.GlossaryInputConfig.GcsSource
member.summary:
Required. Google Cloud Storage location of glossary data. File format is determined based on the filename extension. API returns [google.rpc.Code.INVALID_ARGUMENT] for unsupported URI-s and file formats. Wildcards are not allowed. This must be a single file in one of the following formats:
For unidirectional glossaries:
- TSV/CSV (`.tsv`/`.csv`): 2 column file, tab- or comma-separated. The first column is source text. The second column is target text. The file must not contain headers. That is, the first row is data, not column names.
- TMX (`.tmx`): TMX file with parallel data defining source/target term pairs.
For equivalent term sets glossaries:
- CSV (`.csv`): Multi-column CSV file defining equivalent glossary terms in multiple languages. See documentation for more information - [glossaries](https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/glossary).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.InputConfig.MimeType
member.summary: Optional. Can be "text/plain" or "text/html". For `.tsv`, "text/html" is used if mime_type is missing. For `.html`, this field must be "text/html" or empty. For `.txt`, this field must be "text/plain" or empty.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.LanguageCodePair.SourceLanguageCode
member.summary: Required. The BCP-47 language code of the input text, for example, "en-US". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.LanguageCodePair.TargetLanguageCode
member.summary: Required. The BCP-47 language code for translation output, for example, "zh-CN". Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.LanguageCodesSet
member.summary: Used with equivalent term set glossaries.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.LanguageCodesSet.LanguageCodes
member.summary: The BCP-47 language code(s) for terms defined in the glossary. All entries are unique. The list contains at least two entries. Expected to be an exact match for GlossaryTerm.language_code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.ListGlossariesResponse.Glossaries
member.summary: The list of glossaries for a project.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.ListGlossariesResponse.NextPageToken
member.summary: A token to retrieve a page of results. Pass this value in the [ListGlossariesRequest.page_token] field in the subsequent call to `ListGlossaries` method to retrieve the next page of results.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.ListLocationsResponse.Locations
member.summary: A list of locations that matches the specified filter in the request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.ListOperationsResponse.Operations
member.summary: A list of operations that matches the specified filter in the request.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location
member.summary: A resource that represents Google Cloud Platform location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location.DisplayName
member.summary: The friendly name for this location, typically a nearby city name. For example, "Tokyo".

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location.Labels
member.summary:
Cross-service attributes for the location. For example
{"cloud.googleapis.com/region": "us-east1"}

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location.LocationId
member.summary: The canonical id for this location. For example: `"us-east1"`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location.Metadata
member.summary: Service-specific metadata. For example the available capacity at the given location.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Location.Name
member.summary: Resource name for the location, which may vary between implementations. For example: `"projects /example-project/locations/us-east1"`

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation
member.summary: This resource represents a long-running operation that is the result of a network API call.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation.Done
member.summary: If the value is `false`, it means the operation is still in progress. If `true`, the operation is completed, and either `error` or `response` is available.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation.Error
member.summary: The error result of the operation in case of failure or cancellation.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation.Metadata
member.summary: Service-specific metadata associated with the operation. It typically contains progress information and common metadata such as create time. Some services might not provide such metadata. Any method that returns a long-running operation should document the metadata type, if any.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation.Name
member.summary: The server-assigned name, which is only unique within the same service that originally returns it. If you use the default HTTP mapping, the `name` should be a resource name ending with `operations/{unique_id}`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Operation.Response
member.summary: The normal response of the operation in case of success. If the original method returns no data on success, such as `Delete`, the response is `google.protobuf.Empty`. If the original method is standard `Get`/`Create`/`Update`, the response should be the resource. For other methods, the response should have the type `XxxResponse`, where `Xxx` is the original method name. For example, if the original method name is `TakeSnapshot()`, the inferred response type is `TakeSnapshotResponse`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.OutputConfig.GcsDestination
member.summary:
Google Cloud Storage destination for output content. For every single input file (for example, gs://a/b/c.[extension]), we generate at most 2 * n output files. (n is the # of target_language_codes in the BatchTranslateTextRequest).
Output files (tsv) generated are compliant with RFC 4180 except that record delimiters are '\n' instead of '\r\n'. We don't provide any way to change record delimiters.
While the input files are being processed, we write/update an index file 'index.csv' under 'output_uri_prefix' (for example, gs://translation-test/index.csv) The index file is generated/updated as new files are being translated. The format is:
input_file,target_language_code,translations_file,errors_file, glossary_translations_file,glossary_errors_file
input_file is one file we matched using gcs_source.input_uri. target_language_code is provided in the request. translations_file contains the translations. (details provided below) errors_file contains the errors during processing of the file. (details below). Both translations_file and errors_file could be empty strings if we have no content to output. glossary_translations_file and glossary_errors_file are always empty strings if the input_file is tsv. They could also be empty if we have no content to output.
Once a row is present in index.csv, the input/output matching never changes. Callers should also expect all the content in input_file are processed and ready to be consumed (that is, no partial output file is written).
The format of translations_file (for target language code 'trg') is: gs://translation_test/a_b_c_'trg'_translations.[extension]
If the input file extension is tsv, the output has the following columns: Column 1: ID of the request provided in the input, if it's not provided in the input, then the input row number is used (0-based). Column 2: source sentence. Column 3: translation without applying a glossary. Empty string if there is an error. Column 4 (only present if a glossary is provided in the request): translation after applying the glossary. Empty string if there is an error applying the glossary. Could be same string as column 3 if there is no glossary applied.
If input file extension is a txt or html, the translation is directly written to the output file. If glossary is requested, a separate glossary_translations_file has format of gs://translation_test/a_b_c_'trg'_glossary_translations.[extension]
The format of errors file (for target language code 'trg') is: gs://translation_test/a_b_c_'trg'_errors.[extension]
If the input file extension is tsv, errors_file contains the following: Column 1: ID of the request provided in the input, if it's not provided in the input, then the input row number is used (0-based). Column 2: source sentence. Column 3: Error detail for the translation. Could be empty. Column 4 (only present if a glossary is provided in the request): Error when applying the glossary.
If the input file extension is txt or html, glossary_error_file will be generated that contains error details. glossary_error_file has format of gs://translation_test/a_b_c_'trg'_glossary_errors.[extension]

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Status
member.summary:
The `Status` type defines a logical error model that is suitable for different programming environments, including REST APIs and RPC APIs. It is used by [gRPC](https://github.com/grpc). Each `Status` message contains three pieces of data: error code, error message, and error details.
You can find out more about this error model and how to work with it in the [API Design Guide](https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/errors).

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Status.Code
member.summary: The status code, which should be an enum value of google.rpc.Code.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Status.Details
member.summary: A list of messages that carry the error details. There is a common set of message types for APIs to use.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Status.Message
member.summary: A developer-facing error message, which should be in English. Any user-facing error message should be localized and sent in the google.rpc.Status.details field, or localized by the client.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguage
member.summary: A single supported language response corresponds to information related to one supported language.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguage.DisplayName
member.summary: Human readable name of the language localized in the display language specified in the request.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguage.LanguageCode
member.summary: Supported language code, generally consisting of its ISO 639-1 identifier, for example, 'en', 'ja'. In certain cases, BCP-47 codes including language and region identifiers are returned (for example, 'zh-TW' and 'zh-CN')

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguage.SupportSource
member.summary: Can be used as source language.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguage.SupportTarget
member.summary: Can be used as target language.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguages
member.summary: The response message for discovering supported languages.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.SupportedLanguages.Languages
member.summary: A list of supported language responses. This list contains an entry for each language the Translation API supports.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextGlossaryConfig
member.summary: Configures which glossary should be used for a specific target language, and defines options for applying that glossary.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextGlossaryConfig.Glossary
member.summary:
Required. The `glossary` to be applied for this translation.
The format depends on glossary:
- User provided custom glossary: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/glossaries /{glossary-id}`

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextGlossaryConfig.IgnoreCase
member.summary: Optional. Indicates match is case-insensitive. Default value is false if missing.

member.name: T:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest
member.summary: The request message for synchronous translation.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.Contents
member.summary: Required. The content of the input in string format. We recommend the total content be less than 30k codepoints. Use BatchTranslateText for larger text.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.GlossaryConfig
member.summary: Optional. Glossary to be applied. The glossary must be within the same region (have the same location-id) as the model, otherwise an INVALID_ARGUMENT (400) error is returned.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.Labels
member.summary:
Optional. The labels with user-defined metadata for the request.
Label keys and values can be no longer than 63 characters (Unicode codepoints), can only contain lowercase letters, numeric characters, underscores and dashes. International characters are allowed. Label values are optional. Label keys must start with a letter.
See https://cloud.google.com/translate/docs/advanced/labels for more information.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.MimeType
member.summary: Optional. The format of the source text, for example, "text/html", "text/plain". If left blank, the MIME type defaults to "text/html".

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.Model
member.summary:
Optional. The `model` type requested for this translation.
The format depends on model type:
- AutoML Translation models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/{model-id}`
- General (built-in) models: `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/general/nmt`, `projects/{project-number-or-id}/locations/{location-id}/models/general/base`
For global (non-regionalized) requests, use `location-id` `global`. For example, `projects/{project-number- or-id}/locations/global/models/general/nmt`.
If missing, the system decides which google base model to use.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.SourceLanguageCode
member.summary: Optional. The BCP-47 language code of the input text if known, for example, "en-US" or "sr-Latn". Supported language codes are listed in Language Support. If the source language isn't specified, the API attempts to identify the source language automatically and returns the source language within the response.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextRequest.TargetLanguageCode
member.summary: Required. The BCP-47 language code to use for translation of the input text, set to one of the language codes listed in Language Support.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextResponse.GlossaryTranslations
member.summary: Text translation responses if a glossary is provided in the request. This can be the same as `translations` if no terms apply. This field has the same length as `contents`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.TranslateTextResponse.Translations
member.summary: Text translation responses with no glossary applied. This field has the same length as `contents`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Translation.DetectedLanguageCode
member.summary: The BCP-47 language code of source text in the initial request, detected automatically, if no source language was passed within the initial request. If the source language was passed, auto-detection of the language does not occur and this field is empty.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Translation.Model
member.summary:
Only present when `model` is present in the request. `model` here is normalized to have project number.
For example: If the `model` requested in TranslationTextRequest is `projects/{project-id}/locations /{location-id}/models/general/nmt` then `model` here would be normalized to `projects/{project- number}/locations/{location-id}/models/general/nmt`.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.Translation.TranslatedText
member.summary: Text translated into the target language.

member.name: P:Google.Apis.Translate.v3.Data.WaitOperationRequest.Timeout
member.summary: The maximum duration to wait before timing out. If left blank, the wait will be at most the time permitted by the underlying HTTP/RPC protocol. If RPC context deadline is also specified, the shorter one will be used.
